October 1941.Copy No. 6 war CABINET.LABOUR FOR MACHINE TOOL MANUFACTURE.Memorandum by the Minister of Supply.REPRESENTATIVES of the Office of Production- Management require that the Machine Tool and Tool and Gauge Industries should work their plant to the fullest possible extent by day and by night.These American representatives report that the supply of any further toolsfrom the United States will depend upon our carrying out this condition.On the 28th October a Conference was held of all Machine Tool firms. Idemanded the fullest output that could be given.Almost all the firms present declared that increase in their output depended upon the fulfilment of demands for labour already made. It was pointed outthat the fulfilment of my demand for fully balanced night shifts depended whollyon the supply of the labour required.It is estimated that the Machine Tool and Tool and Gauge Industries need750 women and 250 men a week for the next twenty weeks. 15,000 women and5,000 men are wanted to complete night shifts. In most cases canteens andother necessary facilities for the employment of women have already beenprovided and await the supply of labour.The Machine Tool and Tool and Gauge Industries, as the key Industries ofWar Production, should rank above all other Industries in priority. This should apply to their labour demands.It is requested that an order should be given to the Ministry of Labour to fulfil the requirements of firms in these Industries as and when the demands arenotified.B.October 28, 1941.SECRET.W.P. (G) (41) 123.October 28, 1941.[23078]
